text: How can I merge two Python dictionaries as a single expression?
I have two Python dictionaries, and I want to write a single expression that returns these two dictionaries, merged.
The update() method would be what I need, if it returned its result instead of modifying a dict in-place.

code:
>>> x = {'a':1, 'b': 2}
>>> y = {'b':10, 'c': 11}
>>> z = x.update(y)
>>> print z
None
>>> x
{'a': 1, 'b': 10, 'c': 11}

text: So I want that final merged dict in z, not x.
